channel.title: terms on Merak.run
channel.description: Recent content in terms on Merak.run

item.title: IBC
item.description: IBC stands for Inter-Blockchain Communication Protocol, which allows different blockchains to communicate between them (via relayer) and transfer assets

item.title: Airdrop
item.description: An airdrop is a campaign that usually requires several social media steps like: Telegram group or channel follow Twitter actions such as like and retweet plus tag friends submit a form with some data. etc. In exchange, your address is added to a list that later is validated to check if all the requirements are satisfied to receive some free tokens. Some airdrops have as prerequisites being owner of another cryptocurrency or to perform additional steps like community activity in the chats, etc.

item.title: Airdrop
item.description: An airdrop is a campaign that usually requires several social media steps like: Telegram group or channel follow Twitter actions such as like and retweet plus tag friends submit a form with some data. etc. In exchange, your address is added to a list that later is validated to check if all the requirements are satisfied to receive some free tokens. Some airdrops have as prerequisites being owner of another cryptocurrency or to perform additional steps like community activity in the chats, etc.

item.title: Altcoin
item.description: Altcoin makes references to Alternative Coins, and refers to other cryptocurrencies that appeared under the umbrella of the successful Bitcoin trying to overcome some of the problems it has.

item.title: Altcoin
item.description: Altcoin makes references to Alternative Coins, and refers to other cryptocurrencies that appeared under the umbrella of the successful Bitcoin trying to overcome some of the problems it has.

item.title: Binance
item.description: Binance is an exchange for quickly trading and converting between crypto currencies. Binance allows adding funds via wire transfer, credit card, etc and transfer the assets to other exchanges or wallets.

item.title: Binance
item.description: Binance is an exchange for quickly trading and converting between crypto currencies. Binance allows adding funds via wire transfer, credit card, etc and transfer the assets to other exchanges or wallets.

item.title: Block Explorer
item.description: A block explorer is a web tool that allows to browse the blockchain, it’s useful to examine a transaction performed or the contracts we’re interacting to. A link to a specific transaction can be provided to another user for verification purposes as it shows the amount, sender and recipient wallets. Each chain or network has its own block explorer.

item.title: Block Explorer
item.description: A block explorer is a web tool that allows to examinate the blockchain, it’s useful to examine a transaction performed or the contracts we’re interacting to. A link to a specific transaction can be provided to another user for verification purposes as it shows the amount, sender and recipient wallets. Each chain or network has its own block explorer.

item.title: Blockchain
item.description: Blockchain is the term that describes the relationship between different blocks where data is stored. Each block has a correspondence with prior and next blocks, allowing data to be authenticated and not tampered by a network of hosts that keep a copy of the blockchain, keeping record of all the transactions happening at each block.

item.title: Blockchain
item.description: Blockchain is the term that describes the relationship between different blocks where data is stored. Each block has a correspondence with prior and next blocks, allowing data to be authenticated and not tampered by a network of hosts that keep a copy of the blockchain, keeping record of all the transactions happening at each block.

item.title: Bridge
item.description: A swap is a service that exchanges one asset for another, but sometimes, each asset are on different networks… in this case, a Bridge, allows to move assets from one network to another. Check Swap places for some examples.

item.title: cliff
item.description: Cliff is the amount of time that should pass before the tokens are liberated and available. Each project might setup different periods based on the project participants (public sale, private, etc.) In addition, it might also include a vesting in addition to the cliff itself.

item.title: Coinbase
item.description: Coinbase is an exchange for quickly trading and converting between crypto currencies. Coinbase features a nice dashboard and mobile application to keep track of your portfolio. A good feature is Coinbase Earn, which allows to learn about some crypto currencies and get some in exchange for free!

item.title: Coinbase
item.description: Coinbase is an exchange for quickly trading and converting between crypto currencies. Coinbase features a nice dashboard and mobile application to keep track of your portfolio. A good feature is Coinbase Earn, which allows to learn about some crypto currencies and get some in exchange for free!

item.title: Coinlist
item.description: Coinlist is an exchange for quickly trading and participating in new token sales.. It’s the place selected by many projects to perform their initial token launch and sales, so it’s important to be there. It features a ‘karma’ based system that allows you to be on a priority list when those sales happen, helping you getting closer to secure a slot in the sale before it depletes.

item.title: Contract address
item.description: Contract address is the direction used for indicating in a specific network information about a crypto currency, for example: Currency Network Contract BTCST Binance Smart Chain 0x78650B139471520656B9E7AA7A5E9276814A38E9 TRX Binance Smart Chain 0xf230b790E05390FC8295F4d3F60332c93BEd42e2 DAI Ethereum 0x6b175474e89094c44da98b954eedeac495271d0f A given currency might have presence on different networks, so the contract on each one of them will be different. Always pay real attention to the contract address, specially when adding it to your wallet to make sure you’re not stolen by fake contracts.

item.title: Contract address
item.description: Contract address is the direction used for indicating in a specific network information about a crypto currency, for example: Currency Network Contract BTCST Binance Smart Chain 0x78650B139471520656B9E7AA7A5E9276814A38E9 TRX Binance Smart Chain 0xf230b790E05390FC8295F4d3F60332c93BEd42e2 DAI Ethereum 0x6b175474e89094c44da98b954eedeac495271d0f A given currency might have presence on different networks, so the contract on each one of them will be different. Always pay real attention to the contract address, specially when adding it to your wallet to make sure you’re not stolen by fake contracts.

item.title: Cosmos
item.description: Cosmos is one of the ecosystems which is having a great growth and its usable for example via cosmostation or via keplr.

item.title: DeFi
item.description: DeFi stands for Decentralized Finance, that is, moving the finances out of central places like traditional banks.

item.title: delegate
item.description: Check staking to learn more about what delegating means.

item.title: DYOR
item.description: DYOR stands for ‘Do your own research’, meaning that the information provided is just information and not financial advise and it’s only you performing your research and investigation, the one making the decision about the topic.

item.title: Exchange
item.description: An exchange is a service that allows to buy with regular money or with cryptocurrencies to transform between them and operate, in a similar way to what a broker does for regular stock. Check a list of exchanges.

item.title: Exchange
item.description: An exchange is a service that allows to buy with regular money or with cryptocurrencies to transform between them and operate, in a similar way to what a broker does for regular stock. Check a list of exchanges.

item.title: FOMO
item.description: F.O.M.O. : Fear Of Missing Out It makes reference to the fear that arises when lots of people buy one crypto currency that is gaining momentum and might drive you into buying something about to fall.

item.title: FOMO
item.description: F.O.M.O. : Fear Of Missing Out It makes reference to the fear that arises when lot of people buy one crypto currency that is gaining momentum and might drive you into buying something about to fall.

item.title: FTX
item.description: FTX is a recently created exchange with a custom token FTX which has shown very high appreciation. As with other exchanges, it allows to load credit based on different cryptocurrency deposits or traditional banking approaches.

item.title: Gas
item.description: Each time a transaction happens on a network, there are some fees that are paid to the nodes validating the transaction, this is usually called gas, and it’s the commission that is paid. Each network has its own type of gas, for example on Binance Smart Chain, the gas is paid with BNB, on xDAI is paid with DAI tokens and on Ethereum with ETH. As transactions require gas to cover the expenses, it’s always good to keep some amount of gas on the networks we operate to pay and be able to perform them.

item.title: Gas
item.description: Each time a transaction happens on a network, there are some fees that are paid to the nodes validating the transaction, this is usually called gas, and it’s the commission that is paid. Each network has its own type of gas, for example on Binance Smart Chain, the gas is paid with BNB, on xDAI is paid with DAI tokens and on Ethereum with ETH. As transactions require gas to cover the expenses, it’s always good to keep some amount of gas on the networks we operate to pay and be able to perform them.

item.title: Gate.io
item.description: Gate.io is an Exchange similar to others published.

item.title: HODL
item.description: HODL The story comes out of a typo (willing to say HOLD) made on a blogpost, when a user said that being a bad investor and holding the positions for longer time could bet the traders that operate in short periods.

item.title: HODL
item.description: HODL The story comes out of a typo (willing to say HOLD) made on a blogpost, when a user said that being a bad investor and holding the positions for longer time could bet the traders that operate in short periods.

item.title: Keplr
item.description: Keplr is a very well-established Wallet for Cosmos ecosystem which allows integration via browser and many sites like Osmosis for asset interchange.

item.title: Kucoin
item.description: Kucoin is an exchange for quickly trading and converting between crypto currencies. Kucoin allows adding funds via wire transfer, credit card, etc and transfer the assets to other exchanges or wallets. It also features Polygon/MATIC purchases

item.title: KYC
item.description: KYC is the acronym of ‘Know your customer’. It is a process that is used to verify the identity of a customer. It usually involves asking for National ID Card, passport or driving licence as well as some utility bills to prove your name and address. It’s used as a way to avoid duplicate accounts and to prevent fraud.

item.title: Metamask
item.description: Metamask is a web wallet that can be installed in your browser or mobile and allows it to interact with Dapps, that is applications that allow to operate with cryptocurrency and its contracts.

item.title: Metamask
item.description: Metamask is a web wallet that can be installed in your browser or mobile and allows it to interact with Dapps, that is applications that allow to operate with cryptocurrency and its contracts.

item.title: MEXC
item.description: MEXC is an exchange for trading. It was the first one to accept ALEPH ZERO tokens to be shared.

item.title: network
item.description: A Network has a different set of nodes, validators, systems, etc, and usually tokens that are used for pay the gas fees for it. Some projects decide to go for one network or another based on the gas fees or features. There are several known networks like: network Ethereum Cosmos Aleph Gnosis/xDai Binance Smart Chain Polygon (Matic) And many projects based on that ecosystem

item.title: Relayer
item.description: A relayer is a host that works as IBC to relay messages and assets between two different blockchain networks.

item.title: Revolut
item.description: Revolut is a service that provides credit cards, either physical or virtual with lot of advantages like reduced fees (or free) cash withdrawals abroad. Additionally, allows to fund the account via another credit card instantly without commission and also wire transfers, so it’s a good way to put money in and then wire it out to an exchange to quickly buy cryptocurrency.

item.title: Revolut
item.description: Revolut is a service that provides credit cards, either physical or virtual with lot of advantages like reduced fees (or free) cash withdrawals abroad. Additionally, allows to fund the account via another credit card instantly without commision and also wire transfers, so it’s a good way to put money in and then wire it out to an exchange to quickly buy cryptocurrency.

item.title: Saft
item.description: SAFT is the ‘Simple Agreement for Future Tokens’, is the document that explains the conditions for token distribution.

item.title: Seed
item.description: A seed, or wallet seed is a secret phrase that should never be communicated to anyone, as it is used to restore a wallet into a new computer or application, taking absolute ownership of it and all of the assets there.

item.title: Seed
item.description: A seed, or wallet seed is a secret phrase that should never be communicated to anyone, as it is used to restore a wallet into a new computer or application, taking absolute ownership of it and all of the assets there.

item.title: Staking
item.description: Staking makes reference to the action of depositing some tokens to contribute with the number of tokens as participants into some action, for example, for mining other crypto currencies. By staking, you are contributing to the network and are able to earn rewards. Some recommendations: DYOR… in the end it’s nothing else than your assets at risk. Avoid the first set of validators, that will only give more power and destroy decentralization.

item.title: Staking
item.description: Staking makes reference to the action of depositing some tokens to contribute with the number of tokens as participants into some action, for example, for mining other crypto currencies.

item.title: Testnet
item.description: A testnet is a phase of a project where a set of software nodes can help on the network to validate the conceptual ideas and practical operations. By participating in a testnet via resources (VPS servers, etc), the participants might get some tokens or cryptocurrencies in exchange, allowing them to become early investors without actually paying for the tokens.

item.title: Testnet
item.description: A testnet is a phase of a project where a set of software nodes can help on the network to validate the conceptual ideas and practical operations. By participating in a testnet via resources (VPS servers, etc), the participants might get some tokens or criptocurrencies in exchange, allowing them to become early investors without actually paying for the tokens.

item.title: TGE
item.description: A TGE is a Token Generation Event, moment when the token is created and contract deployed for a crypto project, usually, at that moment or shortly after it, is possible to start trading.

item.title: Token
item.description: Token is the symbol for a cryptocurrency and it’s associated with a contract to be shown on a wallet like metamask or other wallets.

item.title: Token
item.description: Token is the symbol for a cryptocurrency and it’s associated with a contract to be shown on a wallet like metamask

item.title: Validator
item.description: A Validator is a critical piece of blockchain networks, they receive and validate transactions. A set of validators, is a collection of validators that have consensus on the same blockchain. The voting power of each validator is based on the number of tokens they have in their account, either owned or delegated (staked) by others. As part of performing this validation, each validator is also responsible for verifying the integrity of the transactions they receive and receive a commission for each transaction, named rewards.

item.title: vesting
item.description: Vesting is the process of releasing tokens to the public, it might have a cliff or right from the start, but usually both are combined in most projects.

item.title: VPS
item.description: A VPS is a Virtual Private Server, that is a virtual machine that is running in a provider, but under total control of the user, allowing to install, upgrade and operate, making them ideal for running testnet nodes

item.title: VPS
item.description: A VPS is a Virtual Private Server, that is a virtual machine that is running in a provider, but under total control of the user, allowing to install, upgrade and operate, making them ideal for running testnet nodes

item.title: Wallet
item.description: A wallet is a place to hold tokens, it might be online at an exchange, at your browser like metamask or a piece of software running on your computer or mobile phone. A wallet has an address and it’s protected by a seed phrase that is used to restore it on another device and usually by other methods like pin or passwords to protect it from misuse. Each wallet is used on a network and others, allow several networks, providing different addresses on each one to receive the funds or cryptocurrencies.

item.title: Wallet
item.description: A wallet is a place to hold tokens, it might be online at an exchange, at your browser like metamask or a piece of software running on your computer or mobile phone. A wallet has an address and it’s protected by a seed phrase that is used to restore it on another device and usually by other methods like pin or passwords to protect it from misuse. Each wallet is used on a network and others, allow several networks, providing different addresses on each one to receive the funds or cryptocurrencies.

item.title: Wise
item.description: Wise.com is a platform to make bank transfers (wire transfers) cheap across countries, which is ideal to bring money from accounts overseas into your own country.

item.title: Wise
item.description: Wise.com is a platform to make bank transfers (wire transfers) cheap across countries, which is ideal to bring money from accounts overseas into your own country.
